etymology.description: 之(之) (zhī, "go/arrive") + 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") = a place measured and designated for a special purpose -> temple
etymology.interpretation: The character 寺(sì, "temple") combines 之(之) (zhī, "go/arrive") indicating a place of arrival or visiting, with 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch"), suggesting precision or formal measurement. Together, they conceptually define a space set apart for religious or ceremonial purposes.

examples.chinese: 古寺静卧山间(古寺靜臥山間)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ sì jìng wò shān jiān.
examples.english: The ancient temple lies quietly among the mountains.

examples.chinese: 人们来到寺参拜(人們來到寺參拜)，祈求平安与幸福(祈求平安與幸福)。
examples.pinyin: Rén men lái dào sì cān bài, qí qiú píng ān yǔ xìng fú.
examples.english: People come to the temple to offer their respects, praying for peace and happiness.

examples.chinese: 城外有一座小寺(城外有一座小寺)，供奉着千年佛像(供奉著千年佛像)。
examples.pinyin: Chéng wài yǒu yī zuò xiǎo sì, gòng fèng zhe qiān nián fó xiàng.
examples.english: Outside the city, there is a small temple enshrining a thousand-year-old Buddha statue.
